1:
It is a good thing to give thanks to Yahweh\q and to sing praises to your name, Most High,
\q
2:
to proclaim your covenant faithfulness in the morning\q and your truthfulness every night,
\q
3:
with a harp of ten strings\q and with the melody of the lyre.


\q
4:
For you, Yahweh, have made me glad through your deeds.\q I will sing for joy because of the deeds of your hands.
\q
5:
How great are your deeds, Yahweh!\q Your thoughts are very deep.


\q
6:
A brutish person does not know,\q nor does a fool understand this:
\q
7:
When the wicked sprout like the grass,\q and even when all the evildoers thrive,
\q still they are doomed to eternal destruction.


\q
8: But you, Yahweh, will reign forever.\q
9:
Indeed, look at your enemies, Yahweh!\q Indeed, look at your enemies. They will perish!
\q All those who do evil will be scattered.


\q
10:
You have lifted up my horn like the horn of the wild ox;\q I am anointed with fresh oil.
\q
11:
My eyes have seen the downfall of my enemies;\q my ears have heard of the doom of my evil foes.


\q
12:
The righteous will flourish like the palm tree;\q they will grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
\q
13:
They are planted in the house of Yahweh;\q they flourish in the courts of our God.


\q
14:
They bear fruit even when they are old;\q they stay fresh and green,
\q
15: to proclaim that Yahweh is just.\q He is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in him.
